result.execSummary:
The defendant David Lee Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Chippewa County Case 15CF299, Douglas County Cases 15CF372, 15CF38, 20CF445 and Ashland County Case 15CF158

superMiscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
12:59 PM Defendant David Lee Petersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for David Lee Petersen.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates will plead to sole count, recommends 18 months IC, 18 months ES, concurrent with revocation cases Chippewa Case 15CF299, Douglas County Cases 20CF445, 15CF372, 15CF38 and Ashland Case 15CF158, 53 days credit, eligible for early release programs. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
Defendant makes statements. 
Court orders 3 years fashioned as 18 months IC, 18 months ES, concurrent with revocation cases, Chippewa Case 15CF299, Douglas County Cases 20CF445, 15CF372, 15CF38 and Ashland Case 15CF158, 53 days credit, costs, conditions of supervision include DOC programming, payment of outstanding financial obligations. Eligible for both programs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:24 AM Defendant David Lee Petersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for David Lee Petersen.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Asks for status conference in July. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:44 AM Defendant David Lee Petersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for David Lee Petersen.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:38 PM Defendant David Lee Petersen appeared by video, in custody. Atty Hoffman appears via zoom. Dfd's address 8523 E Baldwin Ave Solon Springs WI 54873 .Peter Krueger appears for state in person. Request $5000.00 cb no possession drugs/paraphernalia. State cites FTA's in MN. State requests spelling of last name. Dfd refuses to answer. State reviews criminal history.  Atty Hoffman indicates Lifelong Douglas County Resident. Dfd has hold and most he could post is $200. 
Court orders $1000.00 cash bail and conditions not use or possess drugs/paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.
